heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 08 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (179°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (232.0°) by approximately 53.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 4.2°C) and outside temperature (up 3.5°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 2856 lux) and cloud levels (up 120 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 4519 lux), cloud levels (up 209 m), and feels like temperature (down 1.6°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 120.5m lower than yesterday, 114.5m lower than the past week, 208.6m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 949m and a peak of 2390m, averaging 1417.0m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and little or no wind. Possible light showers, occasional overcast conditions, and a mix of sun and clouds. Stable conditions are expected under a high pressure system.

washing.phrase: The wind speed is too low (2.3 mph) for optimal drying conditions so drying will take longer than normal.
